Dialogue.Player#1: $CEIdle|$POS1|Hello?! Where the hell am I?! What in the world am I doing here?!
Dialogue.Professor#1: $CEIdle|$POS0|Hello Player, I go by many names, but you can just call me “The Professor”, or just professor is also enough.
Dialogue.Professor#2: You are currently here with me because our agents at our totally secret organization have realized that you've led a rather comfortable life.
Dialogue.Professor#3: So comfortable that you've made statements in your life that completely disregards the misfortune of others in the world.
Dialogue.Professor#4: Therefore in order to shape you into a better global citizen, we will go on a journey to learn many new things about...
Dialogue.Professor#5: ...the United Nations and the UN Sustainability Goals (UNSDG) that have been set for humanity to transition to a much better world.
Dialogue.Professor#6: And we'll also learn some statistics along the way!
Dialogue.Player#2: In conclusion, you've kidnapped me. What's your organization's name?
Dialogue.Player#3: I will be filing an official report with the police the second I get out of-
Dialogue.Professor#7: Calm down. We didn't kidnap you.
Dialogue.Professor#8: At least not your physical body, we didn't.
Dialogue.Professor#9: When you went to sleep, our agents activated a device to help us capture your consciousness and place us in a dream world...
Dialogue.Professor#10: ...where we can learn about the UNSDG goals in a perfectly simulated, safe and yet realistic world.
Dialogue.Player#4: I literally could care less. Let me out!
Dialogue.Player#5: If I want to have a dream, it's gotta be something better than this.
Dialogue.Player#6: I don't need a patronizing dude called “The Professor” to tell me how “I have it easy”.
Dialogue.Professor#11: Well, I am not patronizing you.
Dialogue.Professor#12: And if you want out of this, the fastest way is to just cooperate with us and go on this journey with me.
Dialogue.Professor#13: Whinging is just going to make this unnecessarily longer.
Dialogue.Professor#14: Now, back to the topic at hand.
Dialogue.Professor#15: The UNSDG is an important part of transitioning the world to be a better place.
Dialogue.Professor#16: I have created a path for those who are lost and seek guidance on their journey.
Dialogue.Professor#17: And now I'll be guiding you through the memories of other individuals that I have had the honour to interview,...
Dialogue.Professor#18: ...and therefore can provide you with a sort of simulated interview for you to proceed with.
Dialogue.Professor#19: Personally I call them memoram(s), but there is a longer and more technical name for it that I will not be using.
Dialogue.Professor#20: Now, in some cases, you will proceed with the simulation in a first-person perspective.
Dialogue.Professor#21: Meaning that you will have direct control over the person's behavior and way of talking...
Dialogue.Professor#22: ...and temporarily share their memories and thoughts.
Dialogue.Professor#23: Which means you will be able to understand their background as if they are yours.
Dialogue.Professor#24: And in other simulations you will proceed in a third-person perspective,...
Dialogue.Professor#25: ...where you will experience the interview as if you are in the room with them,...
Dialogue.Professor#26: ...having only  partial control over their speeches, with predetermined dialogues.
Dialogue.Professor#27: Now, since you want out of this as quickly as possible,...
Dialogue.Professor#28: ...why not also quickly choose which goals you want to learn first and go through it as quickly as you can.
Dialogue.Professor#29: It will save you a lot of time not to be too hesitant about this.

Dialogue.Professor#1: Choosing Quality Education as our current topic now, are we?
Dialogue.Professor#2: Good good. As per my observation you do seem to carry with you a sort of arrogance in the way you speak,...
Dialogue.Professor#3: ...which means you most likely chose this because...
Dialogue.Samantha#1: $CEIdle|$POS1|Of COURSE I would've received quality education, you have to be one of the stupidest things my head could ever make up.
Dialogue.Samantha#2: You claim to be all-knowing but you don't even know about how I graduated top of my class.
Dialogue.Professor#4: Now you are currently within the body of a person we have previously interviewed, Samantha Higgins.
Dialogue.Professor#5: She is, as you can most likely guess since you currently inherit all her personalities and memories,...
Dialogue.Professor#6: ...from a very comfortable background, top of her class in a prestigious high school and is very arrogant at times.
Dialogue.Professor#7: Now since you are doing this memoram in her perspective, you will have full access to her way of speaking.
Dialogue.Professor#8: However, I would also highly recommend seeking more... polite alternatives when you are allowed the choices in your dialogue.
Dialogue.Professor#9: Makes my life easier is all. Now, whenever you are ready. I will unpause and our conversation will start.
Dialogue.Player#3: Sure, let's get this over with I guess.
Dialogue.Professor#10: Yes, yes. If you would've let me finish my sentence I would've said what you just said.
Dialogue.Professor#11: BUT I can sense within you a tinge of uncertainty...
Dialogue.Samantha#3: $CEIdle|$POS1|Why am I even doing this? This is laughable considering I already AM thinking of studying in a university.
Dialogue.Professor#12: Are you now? Then you will have nothing to worry about then. This will just be right up your alley.
Dialogue.Professor#13: Now if you don't mind answering my question.
Dialogue.Samantha#4: As a matter of fact I DO mind answering your question actually. Maybe if you would just let me OUT of this stupid-
Dialogue.Professor#14: Great. Glad to hear such ardor from you.
Dialogue.Professor#15: Now from what I understand, you are already considering pursuing a higher education BUT now I understand your uncertainty.
Dialogue.Professor#16: You think it might not be worth it for you to study any further...
Dialogue.Professor#17: ...and that pursuing an education in a male-dominated field won't be worth it.
Dialogue.Samantha#5: I never said anything about that. Are you reading my mind?
Dialogue.Samantha#6: You are ridiculous. I am not the one that thinks studying any further could be a waste of time.
Dialogue.Samantha#7: My brother is the one that's thinking that.
Dialogue.Samantha#8: And of course he would think that too.
Dialogue.Samantha#9: He almost flunked out of year 9 and now he is talking about how he should just join TAFE to pursue a “trade” in plumbing.
Dialogue.Samantha#10: Talk about being the family failure.
Dialogue.Samantha#11: This is why I HAD to consider studying in STEM in the first place. Somebody's gotta make the family proud.
Dialogue.Professor#18: Well aren't you the best sister in the world huh.
Dialogue.Professor#19: Let's not persecute your brother right away.
Dialogue.Professor#20: From what I can observe, your brother isn't doing that badly in terms of his grades.
Dialogue.Professor#21: He can even choose to pursue a university degree if he puts his mind to it.
Dialogue.Professor#22: The problem stems from him thinking that it's pointless as if he gets his qualification from TAFE...
Dialogue.Professor#23: ...he can join the workforce and start earning money right away, rather than having to incur student debt.
Dialogue.Professor#24: Well, let's go ahead and find out whether his way of thinking is true or not.
Dialogue.Samantha#12: Sorry but why am I getting put through this trying to find out whether my BROTHER is making the right choice or not?
Dialogue.Professor#25: Because you are just a loving and concerned sister for your brother and you are just so concerned about his life choices.
Dialogue.Professor#26: Anyways, since you are such a know-it-all, why don't you sort through this table and tell me your observations huh?

Responses.Correct_Professor#1: Correct! The highest education level is most likely to earn a higher income.
Responses.Incorrect_Professor#2: Incorrect! The correct answer is the highest education level 'Postgraduates.

Dialogue.Samantha#1: And here I thought it was supposed to be hard, guess I could be getting out of this dumb dream soon after all.
Dialogue.Samantha#2: From my observation, this table shows that workers with the highest education level tend to earn a higher income.

Questions.1: Labourers have the lowest median per/hour income.
Questions.2: Managers have the highest median per/hour income.
Questions.3: Professionals have the lowest median per/hour income.

Responses.Correct_Professor#1: Correct!, Labourers have the lowest median per/hour income
Responses.Incorrect_Professor#2: Incorrect!, Labourers have the lowest median per/hour income

Responses.Correct_Professor#1: Correct!, It is false, there could always be someone that earns above the median and could possibly earn more than a professional or manager.
Responses.Incorrect_Professor#2: Incorrect!, It is false, there could always be someone that earns above the median and could possibly earn more than a professional or manager.
